page.title: 01Eshott Northumberland
page.content: Eshott with Eshott Heugh covers some 2000 acres and in medieval times had a cattle, town and manor. In 1415 the fortification was called 'Castrum' now tower. By 1624 William Carr had built a new hall, the castle providing stone. This was extended in the 18th century by 2 blocks in classical style. A tower was added, but the old hall has recently been demolished. Eshott is now known, for its milk, produced by fine Jersey and Ayrshire herds. The land is farmed intensively to feed them with grass, silage and corn. There is attractive woodland. The castle a grassy mound, the old village has gone.A medieval kiln was located in the laying of gaspipes. Open cast has not yet intruded.
